interestingFact: Nepal is home to Mount Everest, the highest point on Earth.
Australia is the only continent without an active volcano.

Brazil is the largest coffee producer in the world.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world.
India is the world's largest democracy.
Germany is known for having the world’s first highway, the Autobahn.
Mexico City is sinking at a rate of about 10 inches per year due to the soft clay soil.
Norway is known for its stunning fjords, which were carved out by glaciers.
Japan is home to the world's oldest company, Kongo Gumi, which was founded in 578 AD.

China is home to the Great Wall, the longest wall in the world, stretching over 13,000 miles.
Indonesia is the world's largest island country, consisting of more than 17,000 islands.

The United States is home to the world's oldest national park, Yellowstone National Park, established in 1872.
France is the most visited country in the world, with over 89 million tourists each year.
